thread.title: A Georgia murder suspect was arrested in Boston - Massachusetts news
thread.title_full: A Georgia murder suspect was arrested in Boston - Massachusetts news

author: boston.com
title: A Georgia murder suspect was arrested in Boston - Massachusetts news
text:
A Georgia man wanted in connection to multiple murders and assaults was arrested in Boston Friday, according to police.
Boston police and the United States Marshals Service arrested Daniel Pena, 22, around 8:10 Friday morning after he was seen in the Theater District, authorities said. Authorities in Georgia plan to extradite Pena and charge him there, according to police.
Police said Pena is wanted in connection with a fatal shooting that took place on July 30 in DeKalb County, Georgia. Pena is an alleged member of the Georgia-based gang “Gangster Disciples” whose members have been charged in connection with multiple shootings and assaults that took place from May to August in the area, according to police.
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below Pena was recently indicted on two murders that occurred July 3, police said. He is the last of the gang’s nine members to be arrested.
“I want to recognize and commend the Boston Police, the United States Marshals Service and the Georgia authorities for their great collaboration and hard work that led to this arrest,” said Boston Police Commissioner William Evans. “I hope this arrest brings some comfort to those who were affected by this violence and should send a strong message to those who think they can hide in Boston.”
